title: أَفْعَالُ الْقُلُوبِ - الإِلْغَاءُ وَالتَّعْلِيقُ
titleEn: Verbs of Heart - Cancellation and Suspension
description: Learn about الإِلغاء (cancellation) and التعليق (suspension) - two phenomena that affect the governance of أفعال القلوب (verbs of heart/mind) like ظنّ، حسب، علم.

notes.title: Review: Verbs of Heart
content: أَفْعَال الْقُلُوب are verbs that express mental activities: thinking, believing, knowing, finding, etc. They typically take two objects (مَفْعُولَان): ظَنَنْتُ زَيْدًا صَادِقًا.
These verbs include: ظَنَّ، حَسِبَ، خَالَ، زَعَمَ، عَلِمَ، وَجَدَ، رَأَى (when meaning 'to consider'), and others. Two special phenomena affect them: الإِلْغَاء and التَّعْلِيق.

examples.english: I thought the matter easy (two objects)
I assumed Zayd was coming
I knew the truth to be clear
I found knowledge beneficial

notes.title: What is الإِلغاء?
content: الإِلْغاء means 'cancellation' - when a verb of heart loses its grammatical governance over two objects, and the sentence following it becomes an independent nominal sentence.
This happens when the verb is placed in the middle or at the end of the sentence (تَوَسُّط أَوْ تَأَخُّر). The mubtada' and khabar retain their normal case (raf').

examples.english: Zayd, I think, is standing (verb cancelled)
Zayd is standing, I think (end position)
The matter, I assumed, is easy
Knowledge, I know, is light

notes.title: Conditions for الإِلغاء
content: الإِلْغاء is optional (جَائِز) when the verb is in the middle of the sentence, and preferred (رَاجِح) when at the end. When the verb is at the beginning, governance is obligatory.
The verb must be from أَفْعَال الْقُلُوب. The two objects must originally be مبتدأ وخبر in meaning.

examples.english: Beginning: governance active

examples.arabic: زَيْدًا ظَنَنْتُ قَائِمًا / زَيْدٌ ظَنَنْتُ قَائِمٌ
examples.english: Middle: both valid
End: cancellation preferred
The truth, I know, is clear

notes.title: What is التَّعْلِيق?
content: التَّعْلِيق means 'suspension' - when a specific particle intervenes between the verb and its objects, suspending the verb's governance. The verb is 'grammatically blocked' but semantically active.
This happens with particles like: لام الابتداء، ما النافية، إنْ النافية، لا النافية، and interrogative particles (هل، أ، etc.).
keyPoints: لام الابتداء، ما، إن، لا، هل...

examples.english: I knew that Zayd is indeed standing (لام الابتداء)
I thought Zayd was not standing (ما النافية)
I assumed Zayd was not standing (إن النافية)
I asked whether Zayd is standing

notes.title: Particles that Cause التعليق
content: Several particles 'block' the verb of heart from governing its objects: 1) لام الابتداء (emphasis), 2) ما النافية, 3) إنْ النافية, 4) لا النافية, 5) Interrogative particles.
When these particles appear, the clause after them becomes grammatically independent (like a mubtada'-khabar sentence), though the verb of heart still affects the meaning.
keyPoints: Clause becomes جملة في محل نصب

examples.english: I knew you are indeed truthful (لام)
I thought he was not lying (ما)
I knew whether Zayd or Amr was standing
Tell me who attended (interrogative من)

notes.title: Difference: إِلغاء vs. تعليق
content: In إِلْغاء, the verb loses governance due to its POSITION (middle or end). In تَعْليق, governance is blocked by an INTERVENING PARTICLE.
Both result in the following clause being nominative (مبتدأ وخبر), but the grammatical analysis differs: إلغاء = completely cancelled; تعليق = suspended (الجملة في محل نصب).

examples.english: Cancellation - verb in middle
Suspension - لام intervenes
Cancellation - independent sentence
Suspension - ما blocks

exercises.prompt: _____ هُوَ إِبْطَالُ عَمَلِ الْفِعْلِ بِسَبَبِ مَوْقِعِهِ
exercises.promptEn: _____ is cancelling the verb's governance due to its position

exercises.prompt: _____ هُوَ تَعْطِيلُ عَمَلِ الْفِعْلِ بِسَبَبِ أَدَاةٍ
exercises.promptEn: _____ is suspending the verb's governance due to a particle

exercises.prompt: زَيْدٌ ظَنَنْتُ قَائِمٌ - هٰذَا مِثَالٌ عَلَى _____
exercises.promptEn: زيدٌ ظننتُ قائمٌ - this is an example of _____

exercises.prompt: عَلِمْتُ لَزَيْدٌ قَائِمٌ - اللَّامُ هُنَا تُسَمَّى لَامَ _____
exercises.promptEn: علمتُ لَزيدٌ قائمٌ - the لام here is called لام _____

exercises.prompt: فِي التَّعْلِيقِ، الْجُمْلَةُ بَعْدَ أَدَاةِ التَّعْلِيقِ فِي مَحَلِّ _____
exercises.promptEn: In suspension, the clause after the particle is in position of _____

exercises.prompt: الإِلْغَاءُ رَاجِحٌ إِذَا كَانَ الْفِعْلُ فِي _____ الْجُمْلَةِ
exercises.promptEn: Cancellation is preferred when the verb is at the _____ of the sentence

exercises.answer: Cancellation (verb loses governance due to position)
Emphatic لام at beginning of nominal sentence

exercises.prompt: The verb's ability to give grammatical cases
